review: Happy Camper here - recent purchase of new Samsung tv (not smart) with available HDMI port - not being technically savvy - I was able to get this item going and am now enjoying tons of movies, concerts, youtube with $99/yr Amazon prime - if you have kids or want to have access to tons of movies or music concerts (at your leisure) - who needs a smart tv when you can purchase a fire stick that enables your tv to be smart and stream media ... love, love, love it!!  Without Amazon prime - there is still a lot available but adding prime is like having whipped cream on your dessert every day all year long - who wouldn't want that??

review: Regrettable purchase.  I love Amazon.  I buy Kindles and other Amazon branded items as much as possible.  But... this one should have been a Roku.  I don't like the interface  I've had this long enough that I should have gotten used to it, but it's so different than our internet TVs and Roku's -- almost like everything I've learned is out the window.  But my biggest irk is that it doesn't detect my wi-fi signal as easily as any other device in that exact same spot.  It's bad enough that I don't even get a lot of buffering, it just loses connection.
author: Lynn Benson

review: Great TV now! I have really enjoyed the Fire TV Stick, especially staying in motels a lot. The motel we stay in right now have HD TVs, but no HD signal. The Fire TV Stick solves the problem. I just wish there was a way to link it to my GenieGo.......
